## Table of Contents

### Plans

* [`bolt_log4j::vuln`](#bolt_log4j--vuln): Bolt plan to detect hosts vulnerable to log4shell.

## Plans

### <a name="bolt_log4j--vuln"></a>`bolt_log4j::vuln`

lint:ignore:140chars

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `bolt_log4j::vuln` plan:

* [`targets`](#-bolt_log4j--vuln--targets)
* [`windows_install_path`](#-bolt_log4j--vuln--windows_install_path)
* [`linux_install_path`](#-bolt_log4j--vuln--linux_install_path)
* [`windows_scan_path`](#-bolt_log4j--vuln--windows_scan_path)
* [`linux_scan_path`](#-bolt_log4j--vuln--linux_scan_path)

##### <a name="-bolt_log4j--vuln--targets"></a>`targets`

Data type: `TargetSpec`

The targets to run on.

##### <a name="-bolt_log4j--vuln--windows_install_path"></a>`windows_install_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Windowspath`

File path to install the log4j scanner on windows. Default 'c:\\'

Default value: `'c:\\'`

##### <a name="-bolt_log4j--vuln--linux_install_path"></a>`linux_install_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Unixpath`

File path to install the log4j scanner on Linux. Default '/tmp'

Default value: `'/tmp'`

##### <a name="-bolt_log4j--vuln--windows_scan_path"></a>`windows_scan_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Windowspath`

File systems path to scan on Windows. Will scan recursivly from this directory. Default 'c:\\'

Default value: `'c:\\'`

##### <a name="-bolt_log4j--vuln--linux_scan_path"></a>`linux_scan_path`

Data type: `Stdlib::Unixpath`

File systems path to scan on Linux. Will scan recursivly from this directory. Default '/'

Default value: `'/'`
